definition: Sina, Chinese web portal and online media company
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Last October, Hong Hong began to write her story on Sina.
sentences.chinese: 去年十月，紅紅開始在新浪網上寫自己的故事。

sentences.english: Radiohead recently launched a page on the "weibo" site of leading Chinese Internet portal Sina.com.
sentences.chinese: 日前在中國的門戶網站新浪網開通了“微博”。

sentences.english: The intent that sina net carries king of battalion headquarters CTO besmears brave speaks bilateral collaboration.
sentences.chinese: 新浪網運營部技術總監王塗勇說出雙方合作的意圖。

sentences.english: You can download it from www.sina.com English Channel.
sentences.chinese: 你可以從新浪網英語頻道下載。

sentences.english: Sina said that the figure surpassed the 140, 000 followers of Chinese pop singer Han Geng.
sentences.chinese: 新浪網說，這個數字超過了流行歌手韓庚的。

sentences.english: If our chelsea will cooperate with the sina. com, please pay attention to them.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們切爾西要與新浪網合作，請注意他們的言行。

sentences.english: The Sina Net finance and economics all rights reserved also gives to report.
sentences.chinese: 新浪網財經專版也予以報道。

definition: Sohu, Chinese web portal and online media company
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
Mainichi Shimbun, a Japanese daily newspaper
The Sun (the name of various newspapers, notably in the UK and in Hong Kong)
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
China watcher/an expert on China/an old China hand
